titleStmt.title: C. S. French to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2383

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
WM. WINN
JAMES SIMPSON
R. N. WINN
Deposit Bank, Winn, Simpson & Co.

Winchester, Ky. 18 Decr 1860
Hon Beriah Magoffin
Dear Sir

Messrs Winn Simpson & Co Bankers of this Town request me to say to you -- that there is a vacancy in the Office of Notery Public in this place occasioned by the resignation of A. F. Bowen -- who was appointed some time since -- He received his commission and immediately after resigned -- probably you will recollect Bowen's letter to this effect to you-it being a rather remarkable production=it would be gratifying to these gentlemen if you would appoint Robert N. Winn -- of their Firm -- Notary in place of Bowen resigned -- They wish it mainly for the Sake of convenience in their business=I congratulate you upon your able & conservative letter -- touching present political troubles -- it receives the approbation of all parties &C.

Clarke Co
Notary
Robt W. Winn
Com. Issd. Decr. 22d 1860
